title: A Voyage round Great Britain; with short views of Aberdeen, Balmoral, ... Fécamp, Havre and Paris
author: Hargreaves, Thomas
snippet: There are many bays or indents in the coast with heads projecting far out, and these, with a gale blowing from the east, are sometimes very difficult to escape. The lights are St. Abb's Head, Fern and Longstone near together, Coquet Island, Tynemouth and Souter Head, Seaham and West Hartlepool, Whitby, Scarborough, and Flamborough Head, all being leading lights.
